data.title: Famous Danish People in History
data.meta_description: List of the most famous Danish in history, with famous, important and notable Danish hand-picked by our team of editors and ranked by popularity.
data.text:
Famous Danish People

Home

Famous People

Nationality

Danish

1. Hans Christian Ørsted

2. Niels Bohr

3. Christian III

4. Christian II

5. Tycho Brahe

6. Cnut the Great

7. Hans Christian Andersen

8. Caroline Wozniacki

9. Lili Elbe

10. Camille Pissarro

11. Victor Borge

12. Margrethe II

13. August Krogh

14. Lars Ulrich

15. Kurt Nielsen

List of Danish People

Claudius Clavus, Danish cartographer (probably 1st to draw Greenland on a map), born in Salling, Island of Fünen (date of death unknown)

Johan Friis, Danish statesman (Chancellor of Denmark, helped establish Lutheranism), born in Lundbygaard, Sweden (d. 1570)

Tycho Brahe, Danish astronomer (set new standards for astronomical observations), born in Knudstrup, Scania, Denmark (d. 1601)

Thomas Fincke, Danish mathematician, born in Flensburg, Germany (d. 1656)

Christian Sørensen Longomontanus, Danish astronomer, born in Lomborg, Jutland, Denmark (d. 1647)

Anne of Denmark, daughter of Danish King Frederik II and Queen Consort of James I of England, born in Skanderborg Castle, Skanderborg, Denmark (d. 1619)

Caspar Bartholin the Elder, Danish physician, theologian, writer on anatomy, born in Malmö, Denmark (modern Sweden) (d. 1629)

Johannes Fabricius, Danish astronomer (discovered sunspots), born in East Frisia, Germany (d. 1616)

Ole Worm, Danish physician, born in Aarhus, Denmark–Norway (d. 1654)

Hans Nansen, Danish statesman, born in Flensburg (d. 1667)

Thomas Bartholin, Danish physician, mathematician, and theologian (d. 1680)

Christoffer Gabel, Danish statesman, born in Glückstadt, Denmark (d. 1673)

Cort Adeler, Norwegian admiral ship builder (served Dutch, Venetian and Danish navies), born in Brevik, Norway (d. 1675)

Rasmus Bartholin, Danish physician, mathematician and physicist, born in Roskilde, Denmark (d. 1698)

Niels Juel, Danish-Norwegian admiral, born in Christiania, Norway (d. 1697)

Jens Juel, Danish diplomat and statesman at the Danish-Norwegian court, born at Nørtorp, Jutland (d. 1700)

Peder Griffenfeld, Danish statesman, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1699)

Nicolas Steno, Danish scientist prominent in anatomy and geology, and later Catholic priest, bishop, and candidate for sainthood, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1686)

Georg Mohr, Danish mathematician who proved the Mohr–Mascheroni theorem, born in Copenhagen. Denmark (d. 1697)

Ole Rømer, Danish astronomer, born in Aarhus, Denmark (d. 1710)

Matthias Henriksen Schacht, Danish scholar and composer, born in Visby, Gotland, Sweden (d. 1700)

Peder Horrebow, Danish astronomer who invented the Horrebow-Talcott Method, a method to determine a location's latitude from the stars, born in Løgstør, Jutland, Denmark (d. 1764)

Vitus Bering, Danish explorer of Bering Strait and coast of Alaska, born in Horsens, Denmark (d. 1741)

Ludvig Holberg, Baron of Holberg, founder of modern Danish and Norwegian literature, born in Bergen, Denmark-Norway (d. 1754)

Cristoph Raupach, Danish composer, born in Tønder, Denmark (d. 1758)

Hans Adolph Brorson, Danish Pietist bishop, born in Randerup, Denmark (d. 1764)

Johan Ludvig, Danish politician (Minister of State, 1735-51) (d. 1763)

Nikolaj Eigtved, Danish architect (Christiansborg Castle), born in Egtved, Denmark (d. 1754)

Lauritz de Thurah, Danish architect and architectural writer (d. 1759)

Carl August Thielo, Danish composer, opera director, and court organist, born in Høsterkøb, Denmark (d. 1763)

Adam Gottlob Moltke, Danish statesman, born in Walkendorf, Germany (d. 1792)

Johann Hartwig Ernst, Count von Bernstorff, Danish statesman (d. 1772)

Bendix Friedrich Zinck, Danish organist and composer, born in Schwabstedt, Duchy of Schleswig (d. 1799)

Johann Ernst Hartmann, Danish organist and composer, born in Glogów, Poland (d. 1793)

Otto Friedrich Müller, Danish Naturalist who was a pioneer in the study of microorganisms including bacteria, diatoms, and infusoria, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1784)

Vincenzo Galeotti [Tomasselli], Italian dancer, ballet master (Royal Danish Ballet, 1775-1816), and choreographer (Amors og Balletmesterens Luner (The Whims of Cupid and the Ballet Master)), born in Florence, Grand Duchy of Tuscany (d. 1816)

Johann Nikolaus Tetens, German-Danish philosopher and mathematician, born in Tetenbüll, Duchy of Schleswig, Denmark (d. 1807)

[Benedikt] Bendix Friedrich Zinck, Danish violinist, keyboardist, and composer, baptized in Husum, Duchy of Schleswig, Holy Roman Empire (d. 1801)

Niels Schiørring, Danish musician and composer, born in Favrskov Municipality, Denmark (d. 1798)

Johann Christian Fabricius, Danish Entomologist (named nearly 10,000 species), born in Tønder, Duchy of Schleswig (d. 1808)

Caspar Wessel, Danish-Norwegian mathematician, born in Vestby, Norway (d. 1818)

Hardenack Otto Conrad Zinck, Danish flautist, composer, choral director, and music educator (Blaagaard Seminarium, 1791-1811), born in Husum, Duchy of Schleswig (now Germany) (d. 1832)

Asmus Jakob Carstens, Danish-German Neoclassical painter, born near Schleswig, Denmark (d. 1798)

Hans Gram, Danish-American organist, composer, and musicologist, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1804)

Claus Schall, Danish violinist and composer, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1835)

Heinrich Christian Friedrich Schumacher, Danish surgeon, botanist and professor of anatomy (research work in malacology), born in Glückstadt, Holstein, Germany (d. 1830)

Peter Andreas Heiberg, Danish author and philologist, born in Vordingborg, Denmark (d. 1841)

Knud Lyne Rahbek, Danish literary figure (Om sku skuespillerkunsten) (d. 1830)

Peter Grønland, Danish composer, born in Wilster, Germany (d. 1825)

Jens Baggesen, Danish writer and linguist (Labyrinth), born in Korsør, Denmark (d. 1826)

Christian Günther von Bernstorff, Danish-Prussian statesman and diplomat, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1835)

Bertel Thorvaldsen, Danish sculptor (Dying Lion), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1844)

Christoph Ernst Friedrich Weyse, Danish organist and composer (Ludlam’s Hule), born in Altona, Duchy of Holstein, Holy Roman Empire (d. 1842)

Hans Christian Ørsted, Danish physicist who discovered electromagnetism and chemist (View of Chemical Law), born in Rudkøbing, Denmark (d. 1851)

Anders Sandøe Ørsted, Danish politician, born in Rudkøbing, Denmark (d. 1860)

Adam Gottlob Oehlenschläger, Danish poet (d. 1850)

Jørgen Jørgensen, Danish explorer and adventurer (attempted to rule Iceland), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1841)

Steen Steensen Blicher, Danish poet and short-story writer (E Binddstouw), born in Vium, Denmark (d. 1848)

N. F. S. Grundtvig, Danish writer and philosopher, born in Udby, Zealand, Denmark (d. 1872)

Friedrich Kuhlau, German-Danish opera composer (Elves Hall), born in Lüneburg, Lower Saxony (now Germany) (d. 1832)

Rasmus Rask, Danish linguist and philologist (Investigation of the Origin of the Old Norse or Icelandic Language), born in Braendekilde, Denmark (d. 1832)

Christian Jürgensen Thomsen, Danish antiquarian (named the stone/iron/bronze ages), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1865)

Bernhard Severin Ingemann, Danish author (Tomorrow- og Aftensange), born in Torkilstrup, Denmark (d. 1862)

[Johannes] Carsten Hauch, Danish poet and writer, born in Frederikshald, Norway (d. 1872)

Georg Gerson, Danish composer, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1825)

Christian Julius De Meza, Danish general, born in Helsingør, Denmark (d. 1865)

Johan Georg Forchhammer, Danish geologist, born in Husum, Denmark (d. 1865)

Peter Andreas Hansen, Danish-German astronomer (Hansen hypothesis), born in Tønder, Schleswig, Denmark (d. 1874)

Franz Joseph Glæser, Czech-Danish composer, born in Horní Jiřetín, Bohemia (d. 1861)

Emil Aarestrup, Danish physician and poet (Ritornellen), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1831)

Hans Christian Andersen, Danish author of 150 fairy tales (The Ugly Duckling, The Snow Queen), born in Odense, Denmark (d. 1875)

Johann Peter Emilius Hartmann, Danish Romantic composer, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1900)

Johannes Frederik Fröhlich, Danish violinist and composer, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1860)

Hans Matthison-Hansen, Danish composer, born in Flensburg, Germany (d. 1890)

Johann Christian Gebauer, Danish composer, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1884)

Frederik Paludan-Muller, Danish Romantic poet (Danserinden), born in Kerteminde, Denmark (d. 1876)

Holger Simon Paulli, Danish conductor and composer, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1891)

Hans Christian Lumbye, Danish waltz composer, and musical director (Tivoli Gardens, 1843-72), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1874)

Wilhelm Marstrand, Danish painter and illustrator, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1873)

Ditler Monrad, Danish politician and bishop (Council President of Denmark 1863-65), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1887)

Johanne Luise Heiberg, Danish actress (Romeo & Juliet), born in Copenhagen Denmark (d. 1890)

Søren Kierkegaard, Danish philosopher, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1855)

Niels Wilhelm Gade, Danish violinist, organist, composer, and conductor, born in Copenhagen (d. 1890)

Christian Emil Krag-Juel-Vind-Frijs, Danish nobleman and politician (Council President of Denmark 1865-70), born in Frijsenborg, Denmark (d. 1896)

Hans E Schack, Danish politician and writer (Phantasterne - Fantasy), born in Sengeløse, Denmark (d. 1820)

Jens Worsaae, Danish archaeologist, historian and politician, born in Vejle, Denmark (d. 1885)

Erik Anthon Valdemar Siboni, Danish organist and composer, born in Copenhagen (d. 1892)

Carl Frederik Tietgen, Danish financier and industrialist, born in Odense, Denmark (d. 1901)

Peter Arnold Heise, Danish organist, composer (Drot og Marsk (King and Marshal); Jylland mellem tvende), and teacher, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1879)

Eduard Lassen, Belgian-Danish composer, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1904)

Gottfred Matthison-Hansen, Danish composer, born in Roskilde, Denmark (d. 1909)

Carl Heinrich Bloch, Danish painter (art for King's Chapel at Frederiksborg Palace), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1890)

Emil Hartmann, Danish organist and composer (Towards The Light), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1898)

Fredrik Bajer, Danish politician, feminist and pacifist politician (Nobel 1908), born in Næstved, Denmark (d. 1922)

Christian Barnekow, Danish composer, born in Luz-Saint-Sauveur, France (d. 1913)

Ludvig Holstein-Ledreborg, Danish politician (Council President of Denmark), born in Hochberg (now Remseck am Neckar), Württemberg (d. 1912)

Theodor Philipsen, Danish painter, born in Copenhagen (d. 1920)

Jacob Christian Fabricius, Danish composer, born in Aarhus, Denmark (d. 1919)

C. F. E. Horneman, Danish composer, born in Copenhagen (d. 1906)

Carl Lumbye, Danish composer, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1911)

Johannes Eugenius Bülow Warming, Danish botanist (plant ecology, environment-organism interactions), born in Mandø, Denmark (d. 1924)

Georg Brandes, Danish literary historian and critic (the Modern Breakthrough of Scandinavian literature), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1927)

Carl Jacobsen, Danish brewer (Carlsburg), and philanthropist, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1914)

Emil Christian Hansen, Danish physiologist, born in Ribe, Denmark (d. 1909)

Asger Hamerik [Hammerich], Danish composer, and educator (Peabody Institute, 1878-91), born in Frederiksberg, Denmark (d. 1923)

Georg August Lumbye, Danish composer and conductor (Tivoli Concert Hall Orchestra), born in Copenhagen (d. 1922)

Alexandra, Danish princess, Queen of Great Britain and Ireland, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1925)

J. P. [Jens Peter] Jacobsen, Danish writer (Niels Lyhne), born in Thisted, Jutland (d. 1885)

Ludvig Schytte, Danish pianist, composer, and educator, born in Aarhus, Denmark (d. 1909)

Otto Valdemar Malling, Danish organist and composer (Det hellige Land, opus 46), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1915)

Jacob Riis, Danish-American social reformer and "muck raking" reporter (NY Tribune, NY Evening Sun), born in Ribe, Denmark (d. 1914)

Michael Peter Ancher, Danish painter (d. 1927)

Jørgen Pedersen Gram, Danish mathematician (Gram–Schmidt process), born in Duchy of Schleswig, Denmark (d. 1919)

Peter Lange-Müller, Danish composer and pianist, born in Frederiksberg, Denmark (d. 1926)

Johan Louis Emil Dreyer, Danish-British astronomer (New General Catalogue of Nebulae and Clusters of Stars), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1926)

Thomas Laub, Danish organist and composer, born in Langå, Denmark (d. 1927)

Frederik Rung, Danish composer, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1914)

Wilhelm Ludvig Johannsen, Danish Botanist and Geneticist (provided evidence for Hugo de Vries' mutation theory), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1927)

Hermann Bang, Danish writer, born in Asserballe, Denmark (d. 1912)

Henrik Pontoppidan, Danish writer (Promised Country, Nobel 1917), born in Fredericia, Denmark (d. 1943)

Johan Jensen, Danish mathematician (d. 1925)

August Enna, Danish composer (The Witch), born in Nakskov, Denmark (d. 1939)

Walter Sickert, Danish-English painter (The Miner), born in Munich (d. 1942)

Otto Jespersen, Danish linguist, born in Randers, Denmark (d. 1943)

Niels Ryberg Finsen, Danish-Farosese physician and phototherapist (Nobel Prize for Medicine 1903 for treatment for Lupus), born in Tórshavn, Faroe Islands (d. 1904)

Johan Skjoldborg, Danish writer (Dynaes-Digte), born in Øsløs, Thisted, Denmark (d. 1936)

Niels Hansen Jacobsen, Danish sculptor and ceramist (Trold, der vejrer kristenblod), born in Vejen, Denmark (d. 1941)

Louis Glass, Danish pianist and composer, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1936)

Princess Marie of Orléans French born Danish princess, born in London, England (d. 1908)

Carl Nielsen, Danish violinist and composer (Det Uudslukkelige), born in Sortelung, Denmark (d. 1931)

Max Heindel, Danish-American Christian occultist, astrologer and mystic, born in Aarhus, Denmark (d. 1919)

Thomas B. Thrige, Danish industrialist, born in Odense, Denmark (d. 1938)

Albert Gottschalk, Danish painter, born in Stege, Møn, Denmark (d. 1906)

Jeppe Aakjær, Danish poet and novelist (Bondens Søn), born in Fly, Jutland (d. 1930)

William Orlamond, Danish actor (Flesh and the Devil, The Wind), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1957)

Fini Henriques, Danish composer and violinist (Vølund Smed), born in Frederiksberg, Denmark (d. 1940)

Marie Bregendahl, Danish author (Holger Hauge og hans Hustru), born in Fly, Denmark (d. 1940)

S. P. L. Sørensen, Danish chemist (d. 1939)

Martin Andersen Nexø, Danish writer (Pelle Erobreren), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1954)

Valdemar Poulsen, Danish engineer who invented devices for radio broadcasting, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1942)

Johan Peter Koch, Danish captain and explorer (Greenland), born in Vestenskov, Denmark (d. 1928)

Helge Rode, Danish poet and critic, born in Frederiksberg, Denmark (d. 1937)

Andres Randolf, Danish-American actor (The Kiss), born in Viborg, Denmark (d. 1930)

Jacob Ellehammer, Danish watchmaker and inventor (powered flight), born in Bakkebølle, Denmark (d. 1946)

Karin Michaelis, Danish writer (The Dangerous Age), born in Randers, Denmark (d. 1950)

Johannes V. Jensen, Danish novelist and poet (The Fall of the King; Nobel Prize for Literature, 1944), born in Farsø, North Jutland, Denmark (d. 1950)

Ejnar Hertzsprung, Danish astronomer (Hertzsprung-Russell diagram), born in Frederiksberg, Denmark (d. 1967)

Svend Fleuron, Danish writer, born on Good Katrinedal (d. 1966)

Peder Oluf Pedersen, Danish engineer and physicist, born in Sig, Varde, Denmark (d. 1941)

Johannes Anker Larsen, Danish writer (Vises Sten), born in Langeland, Denmark (d. 1957)

August Krogh, Danish zoophysiologist (arterioles and capillaries, Nobel 1920), born in Grenaa, Jutland, Denmark (d. 1949)

Marie Krogh, Danish physician (co-founder of Novo Nordisk), born in Vosegaard, Denmark (d. 1943)

Ludolf Nielsen, Danish composer, born in Nørre Tvede, Denmark (d. 1939)

Edvard Eriksen, Danish-Icelandic sculptor, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1959)

Hakon Børresen, Danish composer, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1954)

Agner Krarup Erlang, Danish scientist and engineer (d. 1929)

Dame Adeline Genée, Danish-British ballerina, born in Aarhus, Denmark (d. 1970)

Harald Kidde, Danish writer (Aage og Else), born in Vejle, Denmark (d. 1918)

Niels Bjerrum, Danish chemist (ph tests), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1958)

Knud J. V. Rasmussen, Danish pole explorer (Thule), born in Jakobshavn, North Greenland, Kingdom of Denmark (d. 1933)

Benjamin Christensen, Danish actor (Barnet, Mockery) and film director (Häxan), born in Viborg Denmark (d. 1959)

Jacob Gade, Danish violinist and composer (Jalousie ; Cinema Music), born in Vejle, Denmark (d. 1963)

Sveinn Bjornsson, Danish-Icelandic politician (1st president of Iceland 1944-52 and poet (Figur ild), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1952)

Herman Sandby, Danish cellist and composer, born in Kundby, Denmark (d. 1965)

Asta Nielsen, Danish actress (Joyless Street), born in Vesterbro, Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1972)

Peder Gram, Danish composer, born in Copenhagen (d. 1956)

Sigrid Undset, Danish-born Norwegian writer (Kristin Lavransdatter, Nobel Prize for Literature 1928), born in Kalundborg, Denmark (d. 1949)

Lili Elbe [born Einar Wegener], Danish transgender woman, former painter, and 1st identifiable recipient of sex reassignment surgery (autobiography: Man into Woman), born in Vejle, Denmark (d. 1931)

Paul August von Klenau, Danish composer (Sulamith), and conductor, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1946)

Torben Myer, Danish actor (Girl Who Came Bac; Judgment at Nuremberg; Sullivan's Travels), born in Århus, Denmark (d. 1975)

Isak Dinesen [Karen Blixen-Finecke], Danish baroness and writer (Out of Africa), born in Rungsted, Zealand, Denmark (d. 1962)

Siegfried Salomon, Danish composer, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1962)

Niels Bohr, Danish physicist who expanded quantum physics (Nobel Prize 1922), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1962)

Jean Hersholt, Danish actor (Heidi, Greed, Men in White, Aryan), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1956)

Karl Dane, Danish-American comedian and actor (Son of the Sheik), born in Copenhagen (d. 1934)

Inge Lehmann, Danish geophysicist and seismologist, born in Østerbro, Denmark (d. 1993)

Poul Schierbeck, Danish organist and composer, born in Copenhagen (d. 1949)

Carl Theodor Dreyer, Danish director (Passion of Jeanne d'arc), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1968)

Rudolph Simonsen, Danish composer (Olympic Arts bronze, 1928 - Symphony No. 2 (Hellas)), and educator (Royal Danish Academy, 1916-47), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1947)

Lauritz Melchior, Danish-American baritone tenor (National Symphony), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1973)

Ole Kirk Christiansen, Danish carpenter, inventor, and toy maker (Lego Group), born in Filskov, Denmark (d. 1958)

Knud Jeppesen, Danish organist, composer, educator (Royal Danish Academy, 1920-47; Aarhus University, 1946-57), and musicologist (La frottola), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1974)

Valdemar Eiberg, Danish jazz pioneer, saxophonist, and bandleader ("I've Got a Cross-Eyed Papa"), born in Kolding, Denmark (d. 1965)

Kaj Birket-Smith, Danish etnologist and anthropologist (Inuit and Eyak) (d. 1977)

Kay Fisker, Danish architect (Hornbeck House, Copenhagen), born in Frederiksberg, Denmark (d. 1965)

Rued Immanuel Langgaard, Danish composer and organist (Music of the Spheres; Antikrist), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1952)

Carl Brisson, Danish actor (Ship Cafe, Ring, Song of Soho, Murder at the Vanities), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1958)

Kit Guard, Danish actor (El Diablo Rides, Kid Courageous), born in Hals, Denmark (d. 1961)

Henrik Dam, Danish biochemist who discovered vitamin K and won the 1943 Nobel Prize in Medicine, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1976)

Jacob Paludan, Danish writer and critic (Jorgen Stein), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1975)

Jørgen Bentzon, Danish composer, born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1951)

Knudåge Riisager, Danish composer, and music director (Royal Danish Academy of Music, 1956-67), born in Kunda, Estonia (d. 1974)

Aksel Larsen, Danish politician, founder of the Socialist People's Party, born in Brændekilde, Denmark (d. 1972)

Hans Kirk, Danish writer (The Fishermen), born in Hadsund, Denmark (d. 1962)

Kai Munk, Danish playwright and Lutheran pastor, martyr (d. 1944)

Karl Bjarnhof, Danish blind journalist and writer (The Stars Grow Pale), born in Vejle, Denmark (d. 1980)

Ebbe Hamerik, Danish opera composer (Stepan; Marie Grubbe), born in Frederiksberg, Denmark (d. 1951)

Harald Søltoft Agersnap, Danish cellist, pianist, conductor, and composer (Royal Danish Theatre, 1931-66), born in Vinding, Denmark (d. 1982)

Finn Høffding, Danish composer (Karlsvognen), born in Copenhagen, Denmark (d. 1997)

Hans Jacob Nielsen, Danish boxer (Olympic gold lightweight 1924), born in Næstved, Denmark (d. 1967)
